summary: Weezer, often called the Blue Album, is the first record by the American rock band Weezer. Released in 1994, it was produced by Ric Ocasek and recorded in New York. The band faced challenges initially, as audiences preferred grunge music. Their demo, The Kitchen Tape, caught the attention of Geffen Records. The album features singles like "Undone â€“ The Sweater Song" and "Buddy Holly," with music videos that were popular on MTV. It became a critical and commercial success, selling over 15 million copies worldwide and earning triple platinum certification.
title: Weezer (Blue Album)
